cards.content:
Authentication & Authorization

User authentication system with multiple sign-in methods.

**Requirements:**
- Email/password registration and login
- OAuth providers (Google, GitHub)
- Password reset flow
- Email verification
- Session management
- Role-based access control (RBAC)

**Success Criteria:**
- Secure token-based authentication
- Support for 2FA (future enhancement)
- Compliant with security best practices

User Profile Management

User profile creation and management system.

**Features:**
- View and edit profile information
- Avatar/photo upload
- Account settings (email, password, preferences)
- Privacy settings
- Account deletion with data export

**Consider:**
- GDPR compliance for data export/deletion
- Profile visibility settings

Subscription & Billing

Subscription management with Stripe integration.

**Pricing Tiers:**
- Free tier (limited features)
- Pro tier ($29/month)
- Enterprise tier (custom pricing)

**Features:**
- Subscribe/upgrade/downgrade flows
- Payment method management
- Invoice generation
- Trial period (14 days)
- Cancellation handling

**Technical:**
- Stripe webhooks for payment events
- Prorated billing
- Failed payment retry logic

Dashboard & Analytics

User dashboard showing key metrics and insights.

**Metrics to Display:**
- Usage statistics
- Activity timeline
- Performance indicators
- Growth charts
- Export data functionality

**Technical:**
- Real-time data updates (WebSocket?)
- Data visualization library
- Responsive charts
- CSV/PDF export

API & Integrations

Public API for third-party integrations.

**Features:**
- RESTful API endpoints
- API key generation & management
- Rate limiting (100 req/min free, 1000 req/min pro)
- API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger)
- Webhook system for events

**Developer Experience:**
- Interactive API docs
- Code examples (Python, JavaScript, cURL)
- Sandbox environment

Notifications System

Multi-channel notification system.

**Channels:**
- Email notifications
- In-app notification center
- Push notifications (future)

**Notification Types:**
- Welcome email
- Feature updates
- Billing reminders
- Activity alerts
- System announcements

**User Controls:**
- Notification preferences per type
- Frequency settings
- Unsubscribe management

cards.content:
Email Campaign: User Onboarding

Automated email sequence for new users.

**Email Sequence:**
1. Welcome email (immediate)
2. Getting started guide (Day 1)
3. Feature spotlight (Day 3)
4. Tips & tricks (Day 7)
5. Upgrade prompt (Day 14)

**Metrics:**
- Open rate target: 40%
- Click-through rate: 15%
- Conversion to paid: 5%

Product Launch Campaign

Go-to-market launch campaign.

**Channels:**
- Product Hunt launch
- Social media (Twitter, LinkedIn)
- Email list announcement
- Press release
- Influencer outreach

**Timeline:**
- Pre-launch: Build anticipation (2 weeks)
- Launch day: Maximum visibility
- Post-launch: Sustained engagement (1 month)

Content Marketing Strategy

Long-term content strategy for organic growth.

**Content Types:**
- Blog posts (SEO-focused)
- Case studies
- Video tutorials
- Help center articles
- Webinars

**Goals:**
- Increase organic traffic
- Establish thought leadership
- Improve SEO rankings
- Generate qualified leads

Landing Page Launch

Public-facing landing page to convert visitors.

**Sections:**
- Hero section with value proposition
- Feature highlights (3-5 key features)
- Pricing comparison table
- Customer testimonials
- FAQ section
- Call-to-action (CTA)

**Goals:**
- Clear messaging
- High conversion rate
- Mobile responsive
- SEO optimized

API Documentation

Comprehensive API reference for developers.

**Sections:**
- Authentication
- Endpoints reference
- Request/response examples
- Rate limiting
- Error codes
- SDKs and libraries

Development Environment Setup

Guide for setting up local development.

**Contents:**
- Prerequisites
- Installation steps
- Configuration
- Running locally
- Troubleshooting

Architecture Decision: Why PostgreSQL

**Context:** Choosing a database for our SaaS platform

**Decision:** Use PostgreSQL as primary database

**Rationale:**
- Strong ACID compliance
- JSON support for flexibility
- Excellent performance
- Wide ecosystem support

**Consequences:** Team needs PostgreSQL expertise

Sprint Retrospective Notes

**Date:** Sprint 5

**What Went Well:**
- Delivered authentication on time
- Good collaboration

**What Could Improve:**
- Better estimation
- More code reviews

**Action Items:**
- Schedule estimation workshop
- Set up review reminders

Security Best Practices

Internal guide for secure coding.

**Topics:**
- Input validation
- SQL injection prevention
- XSS protection
- CSRF tokens
- Secret management
- Authentication best practices
